00034 
00035 /* for O_DIRECTORY */
00036 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00037 #define _GNU_SOURCE
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 #include <stdio.h>
00041 #include <stdlib.h>
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <errno.h>
00044 #include <fcntl.h>
00045 #include <sys/types.h>
00046 #include <sys/stat.h>
00047 #include <dirent.h>
00048 #include <string.h>
00049 
00050 char fname[1024];
00051 
00052 
00053 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00054 {
00055         char *dname1;
00056         int fddir1, rc;
00057         int fd;
00058 
00059         if (argc != 2) {
00060                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s dirname1\n", argv[0]);
00061                 exit(1);
00062         }
00063 
00064         dname1 = argv[1];
00065 
00066         //create the directory
00067         fprintf(stderr, "creating directory %s\n", dname1);
00068         rc = mkdir(dname1, 0744);
00069         if (rc == -1) {
00070                 fprintf(stderr, "creating %s fails: %s\n",
00071                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00072                 exit(1);
00073         }
00074 
00075         snprintf(fname, sizeof(fname), "%s/0", dname1);
00076         fprintf(stderr, "creating file %s\n", fname);
00077         fd = creat(fname, 0666);
00078         if (fd < 0) {
00079                 fprintf(stderr, "creation %s fails: %s\n",
00080                         fname, strerror(errno));
00081                 exit(1);
00082         }
00083         close(fd);
00084 
00085         // open the dir again
00086         fprintf(stderr, "opening directory\n");
00087         fddir1 = open(dname1, O_RDONLY | O_DIRECTORY);
00088         if (fddir1 == -1) {
00089                 fprintf(stderr, "open %s fails: %s\n",
00090                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00091                 exit(1);
00092         }
00093 
00094         // delete the dir
00095         fprintf(stderr, "unlinking %s\n", dname1);
00096         rc = rmdir(dname1);
00097         if (rc == 0) {
00098                 fprintf(stderr, "unlinked non-empty %s successfully\n",
00099                         dname1);
00100                 exit(1);
00101         }
00102 
00103         if (access(dname1, F_OK) != 0){
00104                 fprintf(stderr, "can't access %s: %s\n",
00105                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00106                 exit(1);
00107         }
00108 
00109         fprintf(stderr, "Ok, everything goes well.\n");
00110         return 0;
00111 }
